business.headline: TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

entertainment.headline: Superman review: James Gunn brings the fun back to David Corenswet-led DC heroRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Superman movie review: James Gunn's new 'Superman' film revives the superhero with a perfect mix of humour and heart, focusing on identity and hope. Featuring David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, the film is a vibrant, feel-good tribute to the Man of Steel.

Did Akshay Kumar use teleprompter for Kannappa? Internet thinks soAkshay Kumar seemed to have used a teleprompter on the sets of 'Kannappa', in which he played the role of Lord Shiva. Internet dug out a video, which is now going on social media, where Kumar is seemingly reading his lines from the teleprompter.

Will Smith to The Rock: Actors who are likely to be part of Allu Arjun-Atlee filmDirector Atlee and actor Allu Arjun are working on a mega-budget sci-fi film, produced by Sun Pictures. Will Smith, Dwayne Johnson (The Rock), Rashmika Mandanna and several others are rumoured to be part of the star-studded cast.

Salman Khan steps out with high security to attend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday bashSalman Khan attended his ex-girlfriend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday party in Mumbai on Wednesday. He arrived at the venue with high security.

Dubai Royal Sheikha Mahra, French Montana spark dating rumours in ParisSheikha Mahra and French Montana sparked dating rumors after being seen together in Paris. Instagram posts and past Dubai outings fuelled speculation, following Mahra's high-profile divorce and business launch.

HBO Max returns: Warner Bros. drops 'Max' rebrand after backlashWarner Bros. Discovery has rebranded Max back to HBO Max, citing the strong legacy and consumer loyalty tied to the HBO name, after the Max brand failed to resonate with audiences.

Wednesday Season 2 trailer out: Jenna Ortega returns with darker twistWednesday Season 2 trailer teases dark twists, new characters, and Jenna Ortega's return. Steve Buscemi joins as principal, Joanna Lumley debuts as Grandmama, and global "Doom Tour" promotions kick off.

Diljit Dosanjh shares new BTS from Border 2, Varun Dhawan-Ahan Shetty make cameoDespite the row over his casting in 'Border 2', Diljit Dosanjh seems unfazed. The actor is enjoying himself on set, as seen in his latest video.

Who was Humaira Asghar Ali, the Pakistani actor found dead at home?Pakistani actor and model Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her Karachi apartment, with the cause of death still under investigation. Known for her roles in TV dramas and the film 'Jalaibee', she gained fame through the reality show 'Tamasha Ghar'.

Siddu Jonnalagadda turns raw and intense for Badass, makers unveil posterAfter the massive success of the 'Tillu' franchise, Siddu Jonnalagadda is set to shed the lingering image with 'Badass', a raw, intense film directed by Ravikanth Perepu. The makers released the first-look poster recently.

Slow Horses renewed: Gary Oldman's spy-thriller upgraded for seventh seasonActor Gary Oldman's British spy-thriller series 'Slow Horses' has been renewed for the seventh season. The show is based on Mick Herron's spy novel series 'Slough House'.

Mahavatar Narsimha trailer: Lord Vishnu and Prahald's epic tale comes aliveThe trailer for 'Mahavatar Narsimha' has been unveiled, showcasing a grand and emotional depiction of a pivotal mythological tale centred on Prahlada's devotion and divine intervention. Set to release in 3D across five Indian languages in July 2025, the film also marks the beginning of the ambitious Mahavatar Cinematic Universe.

Ali Fazal surprises fans at Metro In Dino screening, video goes viralAli Fazal surprised fans with an unannounced visit to a theatre screening of 'Metro... In Dino', leaving the audience thrilled and the moment going viral. The film is already receiving a positive response from viewers.

What to expect from James Gunn's Superman, and why watching Man of Steel is crucialJames Gunn's 'Superman' might bring a new and exciting look, full of action and visuals, but might not go too deep into the characters. However, watching 'Man of Steel' before can help you understand the background better.

John Cena jokes Margot Robbie's Barbie was a mistake that happened over dinnerHollywood star John Cena landed a role in the 2023 hit 'Barbie' through an unexpected meeting at a dinner hosted by Margot Robbie. He appeared in a cameo role in the Oscar-nominated film.

Four Years Later tops OTT romance this weekend, here's all about Shahana's showActor Shahana Goswami's Australian-Indian romantic-drama 'Four Years Later' is all set for its digital debut in India. The series explores the emotional and cultural challenges faced by a migrant couple in an arranged marriage. Here's when and where to binge-watch the show.

Ballard OTT guide: Cast, story, and what to expect from Bosch spinoffOTT's 'The Bosch' spin-off 'Ballard' dives deep into cold cases and corruption. The show premiered on July 9.  Here's all about it.

All about Charlize Theron's The Old Guard 2, Netflix film trending amid poor reviews'The Old Guard 2', headlined by Charlize Theron, has taken over the top spot on Netflix's global top 10 movies for the week. The film ranked number 1 on Netflix in 74 countries, including India.

Timothee Chalamet and Zendaya's Dune 3 official title confirmed: ReportsDenis Villeneuve's 'Dune 3' has entered production. The film's official title has been confirmed and, contrary to fans' predictions, it's not 'Dune Messiah'. Find out more details here.

general news.headline: India of today not India of 1975: Shashi Tharoor criticises Emergency in op-edShashi Tharoor, in the op-ed, highlighted how the world remained unaware of the horrific realities during the Emergency, including custodial torture and extrajudicial killings.

Tremors jolt Delhi-NCR after 4.4 magnitude earthquake hits Haryana townStrong earthquake tremors jolted Delhi and its adjoining regions on Thursday morning. It started at 9.04 am and lasted for a few seconds.

South Indians run dance bars...: Sena MLA's fresh slur after viral assault videoSanjay Gaikwad, a two-term legislator from Buldhana, was caught on video slapping and punching a canteen contractor at the Akashwani MLA residence in Mumbai for allegedly serving stale food.

Man arrested for filming women on Bengaluru streets, posting videos without consentA woman called out an Instagram account for secretly filming women in popular areas in Bengaluru without consent and posting them online. After her video went viral, police arrested 26-year-old Gurudeep Singh for posting the reels and harassing women.

3rd Test preview: Bazball on trial as buoyant India smell blood at Lord'sEngland vs India, 3rd Test preview: Bazball swagger has given way to uncertainty as England reel from India's Edgbaston onslaught. With Bumrah returning at Lord's, cricket's grandest stage braces for Bazball's sternest examination yet.

Poll panel defends Bihar electoral roll clean-up: Pure list vital for democracyChief Election Commissioner (CEC) Gyanesh Kumar said the enthusiastic participation of the voters of Bihar has resulted in the successful collection of more than 57 per cent of the enumeration forms under the ongoing SIR in the state.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Girls stripped for period check after blood stains found in school washroomAfter spotting drops of blood in the school bathroom, the principal summoned girls from Classes 5 to 10 to the school hall for a strip-check.

Amit Shah shares post-retirement plan: Vedas, Upanishads and farmingUnion Home Minister Amit Shah recently revealed his post-retirement plans. The sixty-year-old task-master said he would immerse himself in Vedas, Upanishads, and natural farming. Citing health risks linked to the use of chemical fertilisers, Shah batted for the promotion of organic farming.

Trump lauds Liberian president's 'good English', the nation's official languageTrump praised Liberia's President for speaking "such good English," sparking backlash online, as critics noted English has been Liberia's official language since its founding by freed American slaves.

Lord's Test: Will the past come back to haunt under-pressure England?ENG vs IND: England haven't had a great record at Lord's in the last decade or so, especially against subcontinent teams. Ben Stokes' men will also be looking to bounce back from their 336-run loss at Edgbaston.

Watch: Ex-Goa Minister gets heartfelt welcome from pilot daughter on IndiGo flightFormer Goa Minister Deepak Dhavalikar was welcomed by a heartfelt announcement on board an IndiGo plane from Chennai to Goa by his daughter, Gauri Dhavalikar, who was the First Officer on the flight.

Trump slaps 50% tariff on Brazil after targeting 7 nations, cites Bolsonaro trialThe new tariff directives, communicated via official letters to foreign leaders and shared on Trump's Truth Social platform, outline duty hikes on eight countries. All new tariffs will take effect on August 1.

Los Angeles tunnel collapses, 31 workers rescued by fire department, no injuriesNo injuries were reported and all workers are accounted for after a massive rescue operation, said the Los Angeles Fire Department.

Red Bull exit came as a shock: Christian Horner in emotional farewell speechChristian Horner has said his dismissal as Red Bull Racing's Team Principal and CEO "came as a shock", marking his first public comments since the news broke on Wednesday morning.

Rahul Mishra blends sufism, art and Indian heritage for Paris couture showFor his Fall/Winter 2026 showcase at Paris Haute Couture Week, designer Rahul Mishra did what he does best - blending art and fashion with a generous dose of sculptural accents.
'Introducing 'socialist', 'secular' into the Preamble was a deadly sin'Former Delhi High Court judge Justice Shiv Narayan Dhingra (retired) gives his take on the raging debate

Don't need tutelage: Brazil hits back after Trump's tariff, rant on BolsonaroLuiz Inacio Lula da Silva's reaction came soon after Donald Trump imposed a 50% tariff on Brazilian exports, citing the South American country's treatment of former President Bolsonaro.

RCB's Yash alleges blackmail after sex abuse charge, files complaint against womanCricketer Yash Dayal has approached Prayagraj Police, alleging blackmail by a woman who earlier filed a sexual harassment FIR against him in Ghaziabad.

Arvind Kejriwal says he deserves Nobel prize, BJP suggests 'corruption category'Speaking in Chandigarh at the launch of the Punjabi edition of a book titled 'The Kejriwal Model', the AAP supremo said that despite repeated attempts to obstruct his government's work in Delhi, his administration had delivered effectively.

From Perplexity to OpenAI: AI browsers are here but what do they actually do?Nvidia-backed Perplexity has officially released its first AI-powered browser, Comet, while OpenAI has announced plans to launch its own AI browser soon. But what does it mean for the AI world?

Trump may be hit by drone while sunbathing: Iran hints at assassination plotAn Iranian official warned that US President Donald Trump is not safe at his Florida residence, suggesting a drone strike, as rising US-Iran tensions fuel fears of assassination attempts.

Rasha Thadani congratulates Shanaya Kapoor after her debut film premiereRasha Thadani extended her support to Shanaya Kapoor at the premiere of 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. She greeted the debutante with a warm hug and praised her performance.

sports.headline: ENG vs IND, 3rd Test weather and pitch report: Will rain spoil Lord's clash?After rain-hit Tests in Leeds and Birmingham, fans can finally expect clear skies and uninterrupted cricket at Lord's, with forecasts predicting sunny conditions and steady temperatures throughout the third India vs England Test.

Day 11 schedule: Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek eye spot in finalWimbledon 2025: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka and five-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek are each just one win away from a maiden Wimbledon final, but standing in their way are two resurgent forces-Amanda Anisimova and Belinda Bencic-both playing inspired tennis.

Karun Nair eyes redemption at Lord's as 2nd chance at cricket nears expiry dateHaving earned a second chance at international cricket, Karun Nair now finds himself at a crucial juncture after failing to convert his starts into big scores in the first two Tests. Another poor performance at Lord's could very well spell the end of the road for the Vidarbha batter, especially with several talented youngsters waiting in the wings.

Red Bull exit came as a shock: Christian Horner in emotional farewell speechChristian Horner has said his dismissal as Red Bull Racing's Team Principal and CEO "came as a shock", marking his first public comments since the news broke on Wednesday morning.

Messi scripts MLS history, helps Inter Miami edge New England RevolutionLionel Messi scripted MLS history with a pair of goals, leading Inter Miami to a 2-1 win over the New England Revolution on Wednesday night in Foxborough, Mass.

PSG crush Real Madrid 4-0 to set up final vs ChelseaParis Saint-Germain delivered a masterclass in attacking football to thrash Real Madrid 4-0 on Wednesday, booking a mouthwatering FIFA Club World Cup final against Chelsea.

Novak Djokovic addresses injury scare after nasty fall in quartersWimbledon: Novak Djokovic opened up on his nasty fall in the dying stages of his quarterfinal clash against  Flavio Cobolli where he won 6-7 (6-8), 6-2, 7-5, 6-4.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
